byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Jeffrey Gettleman from Nairobi, Kenya.
byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and JEFFREY GETTLEMAN

abstract: United Nations panel of inquiry says Eritrean leaders, including those of ruling party, military commanders and Pres Isaias Afwerki, have committed and continue to commit crimes against humanity; panel refers leaders to International Criminal Court.

headline.print_headline: Leaders of Eritrea Responsible for Crimes Against Humanity, U.N. Panel Says
headline.main: U.N. Accuses Eritrea’s Leaders of Crimes Against Humanity

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: A commission urged the Security Council to refer human rights violations by “officials at the highest levels of state” to the International Criminal Court.
lead_paragraph: A commission urged the Security Council to refer human rights violations by “officials at the highest levels of state” to the International Criminal Court.
